roleset.name: reification of :polite.

roleset.name: for nonprototypical clauses: predicative possession

example.name: English: copular clause with possessive pronoun
example.text: The dog is his .
example.umr: (b / belong-91 :ARG1 (d / dog) :ARG2 (p / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular) :ASPECT State :MODSTR FullAff)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: belong-01 in AMR has ARG0/ARG1, which is shifted here to ARG1/ARG2. Belong-01 will still be used in English AMR for lemma-specific instances.

roleset.name: quantification of how strong molecules bind to each other

role.descr: binding affinity constant measured (e.g. dissociation-constant (Kd), inhibitor-constant (Ki))
binding affinity quantity (e.g. concentration-quantity such as '5 nanomolar')

example.name: Kd
example.text: Gefitinib binds wild - type EGFR kinase with Kd = 53.5 nM.
example.amr: (b / bind-01 :ARG1 (s / small-molecule :wiki "Gefitinib" :name (n / name :op1 "gefitinib")) :ARG2 (k / kinase :wiki "Epidermal_growth_factor_receptor" :name (n2 / name :op1 "EGFR") :mod (w / wild-type)) :ARG4 (b2 / binding-affinity-91 :ARG1 (d / dissociation-constant) :ARG2 (c / concentration-quantity :quant 53.5 :unit (n3 / nanomolar))))

example.name: Ki
example.text: TKI258 binds tightly to the FGFR1 KD V561 M ( Ki ~ 35 nM ) .
example.amr: (b / bind-01 :ARG1 (s / small-molecule :wiki - :name (n / name :op1 "TKI258")) :ARG2 (e / enzyme :wiki "Fibroblast_growth_factor_receptor_1" :name (n2 / name :op1 "FGFR1") :ARG1-of (k / knock-down-02) :ARG2-of (m / mutate-01 :value "V561M")) :ARG4 (b2 / binding-affinity-91 :ARG1 (i2 / inhibitor-constant) :ARG2 (a / approximately :op1 (c / concentration-quantity :quant 35 :unit (n3 / nanomolar)))) :ARG4 (t / tight-05))

roleset.note: Typical values for binding-affinity-91 :ARG1 include: acid-dissociation-constant (Ka), affinity-constant (Ka), dissociation-constant (Kd), inhibitor-constant (Ki), michaelis-constant (Km), power-of-dissociation-constant (pKd), power-of-inhibitor-constant (pKi)

roleset.name: discourse relation for contrastive events underspecified for (un)expectedness
roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: but-91 is generic for pure-contrast/unexpected-co-occurrence in the discourse relation lattice. It may cover some of what contrast-01 was used for in AMR (no arg changes), but maybe be quite infrequent in English.

roleset.name: for byline information

example.name: Xinhua byline
example.text: Xinhua New Agency , Shanghai , February 10 , by wire ( reporters Jinhu Xie and Chijian Zhang )

propbank.arg: reporters Jinhu Xie and Chijian Zhang

example.amr: (b / byline-91 :ARG0 (o / organization :name (n / name :op1 "Xinhua" :op2 "New" :op3 "Agency")) :ARG1 (a / and :op1 (p / person :name (n2 / name :op1 "Jinhu" :op2 "Xie")) :op2 (p2 / person :name (n3 / name :op1 "Chijian" :op2 "Zhang")) :ARG0-of (r / report-01)) :ARG4 (w / wire) :time (d / date-entity :month 2 :date 10) :location (c / city :name (n4 / name :op1 "Shanghai")))
example.umr: (b / byline-91 :ARG0 (o / organization :name (n / name :op1 "Xinhua" :op2 "New" :op3 "Agency")) :ARG1 (a / and :op1 (p / person :name (n2 / name :op1 "Jinhu" :op2 "Xie")) :op2 (p2 / person :name (n3 / name :op1 "Chijian" :op2 "Zhang")) :ARG0-of (r / report-01)) :ARG4 (w / wire) :temporal (d / date-entity :month 2 :date 10) :place (c / city :name (n4 / name :op1 "Shanghai")))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

roleset.name: for citations

example.text: French military defeats have been studied extensively ( 1 - 7 ) .

propbank.arg: French military defeats have been studied extensively

example.umr: (s1s / study-01 :ARG1 (s1d / defeat-01 :ARG1 (s1c / country :wiki "France" :name (s1n / name :op1 "France")) :manner (s1m / military) :aspect Process :modstr FullAff) :ARG1-of (s1e / extensive-03) :ARG1-of (s1c2 / cite-91 :ARG2 (s1p / publication-91 :ARG7 (s1v / value-interval :op1 1 :op2 7))) :aspect Habitual :modstr FullAff)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: Lemma-specific cite-01 was used in AMR, but in order to get the arguments to fit, additional intermediate nodes between the cited text and the cite-01 predicate had to be included: ([cited-text] :ARG1-of (a / attest-01 *or* d / describe-01 :ARG0 (p / publication :ARG1-of (c / cite-01 [...])))) This has been streamlined for UMR by reworking the arguments-- ARG1 is now the cited text, and arg2 is the publication cited.

roleset.name: for the X-er the Y-er constructions

example.name: the Xer the Yer
example.text: The lower the price , the more you sell .

example.umr: (c / correlate-91 :ARG1 (h / have-degree-91 :ARG1 (p / price) :ARG2 (l / low-04) :ARG3 (m / more)) :ARG2 (h2 / have-quant-91 :ARG1 (t / thing :ARG1-of (s / sell-01 :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 2nd))) :ARG3 (m2 / more)) :Aspect Habitual :MODSTR FullAff)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

Petja staratel'nyi , a Vanja lenivyj Peter diligent CONJ Vanja lazy 'Peter is diligent, but Vanja is lazy.'

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This roleset is identical to contrast-01 used in AMR, just renamed with -91.

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

roleset.name: distribution range (incl. for a normal distribution)

role.descr: radius, distance from center to bounds
confidence that value is in range, typically a percentage, e.g. 95%
deviation covered by range, e.g. standard-deviation, standard-error-of-the-mean

example.name: center and radius
example.amr: (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (c / concentration-quantity :quant 142.0 :unit (n / nanomolar)) :ARG4 (c2 / concentration-quantity :quant 15.7 :unit (n2 / nanomolar)))
example.umr: (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (c / concentration-quantity :quant 142.0 :unit (n / nanomolar)) :ARG4 (c2 / concentration-quantity :quant 15.7 :unit (n2 / nanomolar)))

example.name: center and bounds
example.text: a range of 16.4 % - 19 % ( 17.7 % being the average )
example.amr: (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (p / percentage-entity :value 17.7) :ARG2 (p2 / percentage-entity :value 16.4) :ARG3 (p3 / percentage-entity :value 19))
example.umr: (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (p / percentage-entity :value 17.7) :ARG2 (p2 / percentage-entity :value 16.4) :ARG3 (p3 / percentage-entity :value 19))

example.name: with confidence percentage
example.text: With 95 % confidence , 42 - 45 % of voters will vote for John Smith .
example.amr: (i2 / include-91 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG0-of (v / vote-01 :ARG1 (p2 / person :name (n / name :op1 "John" :op2 "Smith")))) :ARG2 (p3 / person :ARG0-of (v2 / vote-01)) :ARG3 (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG2 (p4 / percentage-entity :value 42) :ARG3 (p5 / percentage-entity :value 45) :ARG5 (p6 / percentage-entity :value 95)))
example.umr: (i2 / include-91 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG0-of (v / vote-01 :ARG1 (p2 / person :name (n / name :op1 "John" :op2 "Smith")) :Aspect Performance)) :ARG2 (p3 / person :ARG0-of (v2 / vote-01)) :ARG3 (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG2 (p4 / percentage-entity :value 42) :ARG3 (p5 / percentage-entity :value 45) :ARG5 (p6 / percentage-entity :value 95)))

example.name: with standard-deviation
example.text: The gestational age was determined to be 28.5 weeks ± 10 days ( 2 standard deviations ) .
example.amr: (d / determine-01 :ARG1 (a / age-01 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG1-of (g / gestate-01)) :ARG2 (d2 / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 28.5 :unit (w / week)) :ARG4 (t2 / temporal-quantity :quant 10 :unit (d3 / day)) :ARG6 (p2 / product-of :op1 2 :op2 (s / standard-deviation)))))
example.umr: (d / determine-01 :ARG1 (h / have-age-91 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG1-of (g / gestate-01)) :ARG2 (d2 / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 28.5 :unit (w / week)) :ARG4 (t2 / temporal-quantity :quant 10 :unit (d3 / day)) :ARG6 (p2 / product-of :op1 2 :op2 (s / standard-deviation)))) :Aspect Performance)

example.name: with standard-error-of-the-mean
example.text: 65 ± 3 % ( mean ± SEM )
example.amr: (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (p / percentage-entity :value 65) :ARG4 (p2 / percentage-entity :value 3) :ARG6 (s / standard-error-of-the-mean))
example.umr: (d / distribution-range-91 :ARG1 (p / percentage-entity :value 65) :ARG4 (p2 / percentage-entity :value 3) :ARG6 (s / standard-error-of-the-mean))

roleset.name: nonprototypical clauses: for thetic location

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: AMR used the :location/:location-of roles or their reification, be-located-at-91, for these. This roleset is not the same as exist-01.

roleset.name: a preliminary roleset for incorporating gestures into multimodal UMR graphs

example.name: ELAN transcription with gesture reference
example.text: And he goes ... {counting gesture}

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: No handling of multimodal gestures in AMR 2019. This roleset is preliminary, needed to handle certain instances in the Pear Story for the UMR release. Will likely be updated/replaced as we work on the official schema for multimodal UMR.

roleset.name: reification of :poss; nonprototypical clause: thetic possession

example.name: English: reification of :poss
example.text: the man 's horse
example.umr: (h / have-91 :ARG1 (m / man) :ARG2 (h / horse) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)

example.name: Kukuma example
example.text: Mijiritin ɨarayara
example.umr:
Mijiri-tin ɨara-yara Miguel-CER canoe-owner 'Miguel does have a canoe.' lit. 'Miguel is a canoe-owner.'
(h / have-91 :ARG1 (p / person :name (n / name :op1 "Mijiri") :refer-number Singular) :ARG2 (a / ɨarayara 'canoe') :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This roleset replaces have-03 as the reification for :poss in UMR. Argument numbers have been shifted from 0/1 to 1/2. have-03 is still to be used for English in lemma-specific cases.

roleset.name: reification of :actor

example.name: reified version of a standard English sentence
example.text: The enemy sank the ship .
example.umr: (h / have-actor-91 :ARG1 (s/ sink-01 :undergoer (s2/ ship :refer-number Singular) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (e/ enemy))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This is a new reification for a new role; neither existed in AMR, as these roles were included as numbered arguments in PropBank rolesets.

roleset.name: reification of :affectee

example.name: reified version of an English sentence
example.text: I went to the store for my mother .
example.umr: (h / have-affectee-91 :ARG1 (g / go-02 :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 1st :refer-number Singular) :ARG4 (s / store) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (p2 / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular :ARG0-of (h2 / have-rel-role-92 :ARG1 p :ARG2 (m / mother))))

example.name: reified version of a Falam Chin sentence
example.text: Parte in Thangte hrang ah hmeh a suang .
example.umr:
Parte in Thangte hrang=ah hmeh a suang. Parte ERG Thangte for=LOC curry 3SG.NOM cook.1 'Parte cooked some curry for Thangte.'
(h / have-affectee-91 :ARG1 (s/ suang-00 'cook' :actor (p/ person :name (n/ name :op1 "Parte")) :undergoer (h/ hmeh 'curry') :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (p2/ person :name (n2/ name :op2 "Thangte")))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: UMR replaces :beneficiary with :affectee, which includes maleficiaries in addition to beneficiaries. For reification, UMR introduces this new roleset which is to be used instead of benefit-01. Benefit-01 had a different argument structure (ARG0-giver, ARG1-benefactive).

roleset.name: reification of :age

example.name: Formerly annotated as age-01
example.text: My grandmother is 85 .
example.umr: (h / have-age-91 :ARG1 (p / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular :ARG0-of (h2 / have-rel-role-92 :ARG1 (p2 / person :refer-person 1st :refer-number Singular) :ARG2 (g / grandmother))) :ARG2 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 85 :unit (y / year)) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This replaces age-01 as the reification of :age. Age-01 is Aspectually different from this role/roleset and contains an extra Arg0-agent that does not apply here. Args 1 and 2 are the same here as in the old roleset.

roleset.name: reification of :apprehensive

example.name: reified English example
example.text: Grab a stick lest he attack you .
example.umr: (h / have-apprehensive-91 :ARG1 (g / grab-01 :mode Imperative :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 2nd :refer-number Singular) :ARG1 (s / stick :refer-number Singular) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR PrtAff) :ARG2 (a / attack-01 :ARG0 (p2 / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular) :ARG1 p :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This roleset is new. It covers cases where there are 2 mutually exclusive events and one is carried out with the aim of preventing the other.

roleset.name: reification of :cause

example.name: reification of :cause
example.text: He has no right to be as we are not together .

propbank.arg: he has no right to be

example.umr: (r/ right-05 :ARG1 (p / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular) :ARG2 (h / have-mod-91 :ARG1 p) :ARG2-of (c3/ cause-91 :ARG1 (h2/ have-mod-91 :ARG1 (p2/ person :ref-person 1st :ref-number Plural) :ARG2 (t/ together) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullNeg)) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullNeg)

example.name: Causal argument fragment
example.text: Because I said so .
example.umr: (h / have-cause-91 :ARG2 (s / say-01 :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 1st :refer-number Singular) :ARG1 (s2 / so)))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: :cause was used in AMR as well, but in UMR, what was previously covered by :cause has been split into :cause and :reason. have-cause-91 is now the reification for :cause, and have-reason-91 is now the reification for :reason. Argument structure has been shifted from 0/1 to 1/2 compared to cause-01. Lemma-specific uses ('caused', etc) should still be annotated in English with cause-01.

roleset.name: reification of :causer

example.name: Reified version of a Kukama sentence
example.note: Preference for this sentence is unreified, but reification is available if needed for structural reasons.
example.text: nai kuratata churan ui unipu
example.umr:
nai kurata-ta churan=ui uni-pu grandmother drink-CAUS kid=PST water-INST 'Grandmother made the kid drink the water.'
(h / have-causer-91 :ARG1 (k/ kuratata 'make drink' :actor (c/ churan 'kid') :undergoer (u/ uni 'water') :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (p/ person :ARG0-of (h/ have-rel-role-92 :ARG2 (n/ nai 'grandmother')) :refer-number Singular))

example.name: Reified version of an English sentence
example.text: The rules forbade us from smoking .
example.umr: (h / have-causer-91 :ARG1 (f / forbid-01 :affectee (p / person :refer-person 1st :refer-number Plural) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (r / rule :refer-number Plural))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This is a new reification for a new role; neither existed in AMR, as these roles were included as numbered arguments in PropBank rolesets.

roleset.name: reification of :companion

example.name: Sentence fragment
example.text: She went with her mother .
example.umr: (h / have-companion-91 :ARG1 (g / go-02 :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular)) :ARG2 (p2 / person :ARG0-of (h2 / have-rel-role-92 :ARG1 p :ARG2 (m / mother))))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: Accompany-01 was used to reify :accompanier in AMR. :companion replaces :accompanier in UMR and has slightly different boundaries: :companion is limited to animate entities, while :accompanier was not. Have-companion-91 is a new roleset, not just a new name for accompany-01. The annotation strategy is also different, as have-companion-91 includes 2 arguments-- one for the modified event, and one for the accompanier. AMR modified the event with :manner (a / accompany-01 :ARG0-accompanier :ARG1-companion).

roleset.name: reification of :concession

example.name: although it rained
example.text: The game continued although it was raining .
example.amr: (h / have-concession-91 :ARG1 (c / continue-01 :ARG1 (g / gaming-02)) :ARG2 (r / rain-01))
example.umr: (h / have-concession-91 :ARG1 (c / continue-01 :ARG1 (g / gaming-02) :Aspect Activity :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (r / rain-01 :Aspect Activity :MODSTR FullAff))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset as in AMR, but its coverage is split in UMR between have-concession-91 and have-concessive-condition-91.

roleset.name: reification of :concessive-condition

example.name: Concessive
example.text: Even if you arrive only five minutes late , you will be fired .

propbank.arg: you arrive only five minutes late

example.umr: (h / have-concessive-condition-91 :ARG1 (f / fire-02 :ARG1 (p / person :refer-person 2nd :refer-number Singular) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (a / arrive-01 :ARG1 p :temporal (l / late :extent (t / temporal-quantity :quant 5 :unit (m / minute) :mod (o / only)) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff)))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: new roleset, covers cases where there is an underlying expectation that the conditioning event may not lead to the consequent event.

example.name: if it rains
example.text: The game will be canceled if it rains .

example.umr: (h / have-condition-91 :ARG1 (c / cancel-01 :ARG1 (g / gaming-02) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (r / rain-01 :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff))

roleset.name: reification of :degree (in AMR), and used for comparatives and degree-based result constructions (AMR/UMR)

role.descr: domain, entity characterized by attribute (e.g. girl)
degree itself (e.g. more, most, less, least, times, equal, enough, too, so, to-the-point, at-least)

example.name: basic comparative
example.text: The girl is taller than the boy .

example.umr: (h / have-degree-91 :ARG1 (g / girl) :ARG2 (t / tall) :ARG3 (m / more) :ARG4 (b / boy) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)

example.name: as X as construction example
example.text: He runs as fast as lightning .
example.amr: (h / have-degree-91 :ARG1 (r / run-02 :ARG1 (h2 / he)) :ARG2 (f / fast) :ARG3 (e / equal) :ARG4 (l / lightning))
example.umr: (h / have-degree-91 :ARG1 (r / run-02 :ARG1 (h2 / he)) :ARG2 (f / fast) :ARG3 (e / equal) :ARG4 (l / lightning) :Aspect Habitual :MODSTR FullAff)

example.name: polarity examples, with arg6 consequence

propbank.arg: to reach any conclusion as to the motive and identity of the attackers

example.amr: (h / have-degree-91 :ARG2 (e / early-01) :ARG3 (t / too) :ARG4 (c / conclude-01 :ARG2 (a / and :op1 (t2 / thing :ARG0-of (m / motivate-01 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG0-of (a / attack-01)))) :op2 (i / identity :poss p))))
example.umr: (h / have-degree-91 :ARG2 (e / early-01) :ARG3 (t / too) :ARG4 (c / conclude-01 :ARG2 (a / and :op1 (t2 / thing :ARG0-of (m / motivate-01 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG0-of (a / attack-01)) :Aspect State)) :op2 (i / identity :poss p)) :Aspect Performance) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)

example.name: superlative example, implicit superset made explicit in AMR

This covers some of what was covered by (a / and) in AMR. Use reification if the two events are split across sentences in a corpus.

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

roleset.name: reification of :quant, and quantifiable version of have-degree-91

comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: in UMR, what was previously covered by :cause has been split into :cause and :reason. Have-reason-91 is now the reification for :reason. Arg structure is 1/2 rather than the 0/1 used by the original cause-01.

roleset.name: reification of :recipient

example.name: Reified version of an English sentence

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: AMR used :destination for end points and recipients; UMR splits those into :goal and :recipient. The old reification was be-destined-for-91, the new reifications are have-goal-91 and have-recipient-91. Argument structure preserved.

roleset.name: A and B (of same type) are related, e.g. as family or friends (AMR)

role of entity B (often left unspecified)

example.text: his mother

Because of this, the roleset ID numeric suffix has been changed for this version to -92. For UMR, the two sister-city examples moved into have-role-91, which is better for inanimates now.

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: :unit didn't have a reification in AMR, and it was only used as a sub-role under X-quantity types. In UMR, :unit is used for ad-hoc mensural constructions, so the reification is more likely to be needed.

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This is a new roleset. AMR has a lemma-specific identical-01 roleset, but it is semantically not quite the same so the two should not be merged. AMR used :domain or have-mod-91 for these.

roleset.name: For relative size of subset compared to superset

role.descr: relative size of the subset compared to superset

example.umr: (i / include-91 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG1-of (d / die-01 :ARG1-of (c2 / cause-91 :ARG2 (d2 / disease :wiki "Lung_cancer" :name (n / name :op1 "lung" :op2 "cancer"))) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff)) :ARG2 (p2 / person :ARG0-of (s2 / smoke-02)) :ARG3 (p3 / percentage-entity :value 10))

example.name: 26 of 44
example.text: 26 of the 44 countries in Europe are members of NATO .
example.amr: (i / include-91 :ARG1 (c / country :quant 26 :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91 :ARG1 (m3 / military :wiki "NATO" :name (n2 / name :op1 "NATO")) :ARG2 (m2 / member))) :ARG2 (c2 / country :quant 44 :location (c3 / continent :wiki "Europe" :name (n / name :op1 "Europe"))))
example.umr: (i / include-91 :ARG1 (c / country :quant 26 :ARG1-of (h / have-org-role-92 :ARG2 (m3 / military :wiki "NATO" :name (n2 / name :op1 "NATO")) :ARG3 (m2 / member)) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (c2 / country :quant 44 :location (c3 / continent :wiki "Europe" :name (n / name :op1 "Europe"))))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: UMR only uses :subset in the document level annotation, so reification isn't possible in that context. However, this roleset is still useful when describing relative sizes between subsets/supersets.

roleset.name: for presentation of inferences

example.name: inference in dialogue
example.text: So , make it longer .
example.umr: (i2 / infer-91 :ARG0 p :ARG1 (m / make-02 :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 1st :refer-number Singular) :ARG1 (t / thing :refer-person 3rd :refer-number Singular) :ARG2 (h / have-degree-91 :ARG2 (l / long-03) :ARG3 (m / more)) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR PrtAff) :ARG2 [implicit: prev instruction])

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: Roleset is a renamed copy of infer.01, which was used lemma-specifically and for implicit inference in AMR. Some inferences (like 'I think, therefore I am') that were covered with this roleset in AMR are now covered with :reason/have-reason-91 in UMR. This roleset is still to be used in dialogues where one speaker says something and the other speaker presents an inference based on that information.

example.name: instead of, in lieu of, in place of, rather than, as opposed to
example.text: Tim went for an early morning bike ride instead of sleeping in .

propbank.arg: Tim went for an early morning bike ride

example.amr: (r / ride-01 :ARG0 (p / person :wiki - :name (n / name :op1 "Tim")) :ARG1 (b / bike) :time (e / early :op1 (d / date-entity :dayperiod (m / morning))) :ARG1-of (i / instead-of-91 :ARG2 (s / sleep-00 :ARG0 p)))

example.name: not A, but B
example.text: I 'm not angry , but disappointed .
example.amr: (d / disappoint-01 :ARG1 (i / i) :ARG1-of (i2 / instead-of-91 :ARG2 (a / angry :domain i)))

roleset.name: for cases where an element signifies a meaning

example.name: typing correction usage
example.note: In this example, ARG1 correfers with some error in the previous sentence. Some projects may choose not to annotate these at all, this is only to be used if needed.
example.text: shape *
example.umr: (m / mean-91 :ARG2 (s / string-entity :value "shape"))

example.name: misspeaking correction
example.text: sorry green
example.umr: (a / and :op1 (s / sorry-01) :op2 (m / mean-91 :ARG2 (g / green)))

example.name: speaker is explaining shorthand used previously
example.text: purp = purple
example.umr: (m / mean-91 :ARG1 (s / string-entity :value "purp") :ARG2 (p / purple))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: mean-01 was used both lemma-specifically and for symbols like '*' and '=', as well as for implicit cases. UMR will use this roleset for the latter types. This may be revisited later.

roleset.name: for fixed/semi-fixed expressions that are allegorical or convey wisdom

role.descr: 2nd part of a two-part allegorical exp. Gives a focused interpretation of ARG1

example.name: standard proverb
example.text: The mountains are high and the emperor is far away .
example.umr: (p / proverb-91 :ARG1 (a / and :op1 (h / high-05 :ARG1 (m / mountain :refer-number Plural) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff) :op2 (f / far-01 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG1-of (h2 / have-org-role-92 :ARG3 (e / emperor))) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)))

example.name: standard proverb
example.text: 山 高 皇帝 远
example.tr: The mountains are high and the emperor is far away.
example.umr: (p / proverb-91 :ARG1 (a / and :op1 (x2 / 高-01 :Arg0 (x1 / 山) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff) :op2 (x4 / 远-01 :Arg0 (x3 / 皇帝) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: no such roleset existed.

roleset.name: for publication information, citations

example.name: Special Relativity
example.text: Albert Einstein : Zur Elektrodynamik bewegter Körper ( 1905 ) Annalen der Physik , 322 ( 10 ) : 891 - 921
example.amr: (p / publication-91 :ARG0 (p2 / person :wiki "Albert_Einstein" :name (n / name :op1 "Albert" :op2 "Einstein")) :ARG1 (p3 / publication :wiki "Annus_Mirabilis_papers#Special_relativity" :name (n2 / name :op1 "Zur" :op2 "Elektrodynamik" :op3 "bewegter" :op4 "Körper")) :ARG4 (j / journal :wiki "Annalen_der_Physik" :name (n3 / name :op1 "Annalen" :op2 "der" :op3 "Physik")) :ARG5 322 :ARG6 10 :ARG7 (v / value-interval :op1 891 :op2 921) :time (d / date-entity :year 1905) :medium (l / language :wiki "German_language" :name (n4 / name :op1 "German")))
example.umr: (p / publication-91 :ARG0 (p2 / person :wiki "Albert_Einstein" :name (n / name :op1 "Albert" :op2 "Einstein")) :ARG1 (p3 / publication :wiki "Annus_Mirabilis_papers#Special_relativity" :name (n2 / name :op1 "Zur" :op2 "Elektrodynamik" :op3 "bewegter" :op4 "Körper")) :ARG4 (j / journal :wiki "Annalen_der_Physik" :name (n3 / name :op1 "Annalen" :op2 "der" :op3 "Physik")) :ARG5 322 :ARG6 10 :ARG7 (v / value-interval :op1 891 :op2 921) :time (d / date-entity :year 1905) :medium (l / language :wiki "German_language" :name (n4 / name :op1 "German")))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same usage, added roles for publisher and url.

roleset.name: not a reification of :range-- this is for instances not involved in ordinals

example.name: translation from Chinese corpus
example.text: Ahasuerus ascended the throne in Shush and ruled over 127 provinces from India to Cush .

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: Some languages use have-range-91 for instances like this in AMR, but the :range role was created as a subrole under :ord, and so its reification is also part of have-ord-91 in UMR. This roleset provides a home for ranges outside of ordinals.

roleset.name: for frequencies

role.descr: entity on which recurring event happens

example.name: with :ARG1 and :ARG2 (temporal)
example.text: twice a year
example.amr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 2 :ARG2 (y / year :quant 1)))
example.umr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 2 :ARG2 (y / year :quant 1)) :Aspect Habitual))

example.name: with :ARG1 and :ARG2 (price per volume)
example.text: $3 per gallon
example.amr: (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 (m / monetary-quantity :quant 3 :unit (d / dollar)) :ARG2 (v / volume-quantity :quant 1 :unit (g / gallon)))
example.umr: (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 (m / monetary-quantity :quant 3 :unit (d / dollar)) :ARG2 (v / volume-quantity :quant 1 :unit (g / gallon)))

example.name: with :ARG3
example.text: every other week
example.amr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG3 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 2 :unit (w / week))))
example.umr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG3 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 2 :unit (w / week))) :Aspect Habitual)

example.name: with both :ARG3 and :ARG4
example.text: every other Wednesday
example.amr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG3 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 2 :unit (w / week)) :ARG4 (d / date-entity :weekday (w2 / wednesday))))
example.umr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG3 (t / temporal-quantity :quant 2 :unit (w / week)) :ARG4 (d / date-entity :weekday (w2 / wednesday))) :Aspect Habitual)

example.name: full set of args
example.text: $2 a person every 5 miles whenever it snows
example.amr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 (m / monetary-quantity :quant 2 :unit (d / dollar)) :ARG2 (p / person :quant 1) :ARG3 (d2 / distance-quantity :quant 5 :unit (m2 / mile)) :ARG4 (s / snow-01)))
example.umr: (e / event :frequency (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 (m / monetary-quantity :quant 2 :unit (d / dollar)) :ARG2 (p / person :quant 1) :ARG3 (d2 / distance-quantity :quant 5 :unit (m2 / mile)) :ARG4 (s / snow-01 :Activity)) :Aspect Habitual)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

roleset.name: without consideration of or in spite of

example.name: regardless
example.text: The match will be played regardless of weather .
example.amr: (p / play-01 :ARG1 (m / match) :ARG1-of (r / regardless-91 :ARG2 (w / weather)))

example.name: no matter whether
example.text: The match will be played no matter whether it rains or the sun shines .

propbank.arg: it rains or the sun shines

example.amr: (p / play-01 :ARG1 (m / match) :ARG1-of (r / regardless-91 :ARG2 (o / or :op1 (r2 / rain-01) :op2 (s / shine-01 :ARG1 (s2 / sun)))))

example.name: rain or shine
example.text: The match will be played rain or shine .
example.amr: (p / play-01 :ARG1 (m / match) :ARG1-of (r / regardless-91 :ARG2 (o / or :op1 (r2 / rain-01) :op2 (s / shine-01))))

example.name: without regard
example.text: All employees will be treated equally without regard to race , gender , national origin , color , ethnicity , religion , disability or sexual orientation .

propbank.arg: All employees will be treated equally
race , gender , national origin , color , ethnicity , religion , disability or sexual orientation

example.amr: (t / treat-01 :ARG1 (p / person :ARG1-of (e / employ-01) :mod (a / all)) :manner (e2 / equal-01) :ARG1-of (r / regardless-91 :ARG2 (o / or :op1 (r2 / race) :op2 (g / gender) :op3 (o2 / originate-01 :ARG2 (n / nation)) :op4 (c / color) :op5 (e3 / ethnic-group) :op6 (r3 / religion) :op7 (d / disability) :op8 (o3 / orient-01 :ARG3 (s / sex)))))

roleset.name: for (parenthetical) references to a figure, table, or example in a document

role.descr: clause which points to an figure, table, or example

example.text: We treated CHO-K1 cells with HRG ligand to induce maximal ERBB3 phosphorylation ( Fig. 6a ) .

propbank.arg: We treated CHO-K1 cells with HRG ligand to induce maximal ERBB3 phosphorylation

example.umr: (t / treat-04 :ARG0 (w / we) :ARG1 (c2 / cell-line :wiki "Chinese_hamster_ovary_cell#Variants" :name (n / name :op1 "CHO-K1")) :ARG2 (l / ligand :goal (p / protein :name (n2 / name :op1 "HRG") :wiki "Histidine-rich_glycoprotein")) :purpose (i / induce-01 :ARG0 w :ARG2 (p / phosphorylate-01 :ARG1 (e / enzyme :name (n3 / name :op1 "ERBB3") :wiki "ERBB3") :degree (m / maximum))) :ARG1-of (c / cite-91 :ARG2 (f / figure :mod "6a")))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: AMR corpora appear used 'describe-01' for this purpose.

roleset.name: for tag questions, or rephrasing received instructions in order to request confirmation of understanding

role.descr: entity requestion is being made to

example.name: tag question: isn't _ ?
example.text: He 's hungry , is n't he ?
example.amr: (h / hunger-01 :ARG0 (h2 / he) :ARG1-of (r / request-confirmation-91))

example.name: tag question: will X ?
example.text: Come here , will you ?
example.amr: (c / come-01 :mode imperative :ARG1 (y / you) :ARG4 (h / here) :ARG1-of (r / request-confirmation-91))

example.name: tag question: right
example.text: You must be Jack , right ?
example.amr: (i / infer-01 :ARG1 (p / person :wiki - :name (n / name :op1 "Jack") :domain (y / you) :ARG1-of (r / request-confirmation-91)))

example.name: requesting confirmation with intonation/question mark
example.text: A green one ?
example.amr: (h / have-color-91 :ARG1 (o / one) :ARG2 (g / green) :ARG1-of (r / request-confirmation-91))

role.descr: entity requestion is being made to

example.name: well?
example.text: well ?
example.amr: (r / request-response-91)

roleset.name: be like

example.name: very typical
example.text: Life is like a box of chocolates .
example.umr: (r / resemble-91 :ARG1 (l / life) :ARG2 (b / box :mod (c / chocolate :refer-number Plural)))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This roleset is the same as resemble-01 except for the name change to resemble-91; AMR used resemble-01 for similarity constructions (e.g., 'A is like B'). This will take the place of resemble-01 in UMR for these situations. UMR will not use have-degree-of-resemblance-91, but will use a combo of have-degree-91 and resemble-91.

roleset.name: for score ranges

example.name: French scale
example.text: Jacques scored a 18 / 20 in math .
example.amr: (s / score-01 :ARG1 (p / person :wiki - :name (n / name :op1 "Jacques")) :ARG2 (s2 / score-on-scale-91 :ARG1 18 :ARG3 20) :ARG3 (m / mathematics))
example.umr: (s / score-01 :ARG1 (p / person :wiki - :name (n / name :op1 "Jacques")) :ARG2 (s2 / score-on-scale-91 :ARG1 18 :ARG3 20) :ARG3 (m / math) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff)

example.name: on a scale of 1-10 with all args
example.text: On a scale of 1 to 10 , how much do you agree with X ?
example.amr: (f / feel-01 :ARG0 (y / you) :ARG1 (p / pain :quant (s / score-on-scale-91 :ARG1 (a / amr-unknown) :ARG2 1 :ARG3 10)))
example.umr: (f / feel-01 :mode interrogative :ARG0 (p / person :refer-person 2nd :refer-number Singular) :ARG1 (p2 / pain :quant (s / score-on-scale-91 :ARG1 (u / umr-unknown) :ARG2 1 :ARG3 10)) :Aspect State :MODSTR NeutAff)

example.name: letter grades, with arg 4
example.text: John received a B on the Amrican five - letter grade scale , A - F .
example.note: **ARG4 was just added for UMR-- it was not available for 2019 AMR version
example.amr: (r / receive-01 :ARG0 (p / person :name (n / name :op1 "John")) :ARG1 (s / score-on-scale-91 :ARG1 "B" :ARG2 "F" :ARG3 "A" :scale (s2 / scale :mod (c / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "America")) :mod (l / letter :quant 5))))
example.umr: (r / receive-01 :ARG0 (p / person :name (n / name :op1 "John")) :ARG1 (s / score-on-scale-91 :ARG1 "B" :ARG2 "F" :ARG3 "A" :ARG4 (s2 / scale :mod (c / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "America")) :mod (l / letter :quant 5))))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: ARG4 added during UMR framing. AMR users can choose whether or not to use it for future annotation. Using :scale in AMR was also questionable, since it was only included as a sub-role under the quantity concepts.

roleset.name: for p-values

role.descr: significance test (e.g. t-test, Chi-square test, Fisher's exact test)

example.name: (p < 0.05)
example.text: Protein expression increased 10 - fold ( p < 0.05 ) .
example.amr: (i / increase-01 :ARG1 (e / express-03 :ARG2 (p / protein)) :ARG2 (t / times :quant 10) :ARG1-of (s / statistical-test-91 :ARG2 (l / less-than :op1 0.05)))
example.umr: (i / increase-01 :ARG1 (e / express-03 :ARG2 (p / protein)) :ARG2 (t / times :quant 10) :ARG1-of (s / statistical-test-91 :ARG2 (l / less-than :op1 0.05)) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff)

example.name: correlation
example.text: Raf-1 also correlated with nuclear activated MAPK ( p = 0.0022 , r2 = 0.1525 ) .

propbank.arg: Raf-1 also correlated with nuclear activated MAPK

example.amr: (c / correlate-01 :ARG1 (e / enzyme :wiki "C-Raf" :name (n / name :op1 "Raf-1")) :ARG2 (e2 / enzyme :wiki "Mitogen-activated_protein_kinase" :name (n2 / name :op1 "MAPK") :location (n3 / nucleus) :ARG1-of (a / activate-01)) :ARG1-of (s / statistical-test-91 :ARG2 0.0022 :ARG3 0.1525) :mod (a2 / also))
example.umr: (c / correlate-01 :ARG1 (e / enzyme :wiki "C-Raf" :name (n / name :op1 "Raf-1")) :ARG2 (e2 / enzyme :wiki "Mitogen-activated_protein_kinase" :name (n2 / name :op1 "MAPK") :place (n3 / nucleus) :ARG1-of (a / activate-01 :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)) :ARG1-of (s / statistical-test-91 :ARG2 0.0022 :ARG3 0.1525) :mod (a2 / also) :Aspect State :MODSTR FullAff)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage.

roleset.name: for street address information

example.name: White House address
example.text: 1600 Pennsylvania Ave , Washington DC , 20006
example.amr: (s / street-address-91 :ARG1 1600 :ARG2 (r / road :wiki "Pennsylvania_Avenue" :name (n / name :op1 "Pennsylvania" :op2 "Ave")) :ARG4 (c / city :wiki "Washington,_D.C." :name (n2 / name :op1 "Washington")) :ARG5 (d / district :wiki "Washington,_D.C." :name (n3 / name :op1 "DC")) :ARG6 20006)
example.umr: (s / street-address-91 :ARG1 1600 :ARG2 (r / road :wiki "Pennsylvania_Avenue" :name (n / name :op1 "Pennsylvania" :op2 "Ave")) :ARG4 (c / city :wiki "Washington,_D.C." :name (n2 / name :op1 "Washington")) :ARG5 (d / district :wiki "Washington,_D.C." :name (n3 / name :op1 "DC")) :ARG6 20006)

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: same roleset, same usage

roleset.name: discourse relation between events where the second event is unexpected if the first occurs

example.name: unexpected co-ocurrence
example.text: Vanja caught a cold , but went to school
example.umr:
Vanja prstudilsja , no poshël v shkolu . Vanja caught_cold CONJ went to school 'Vanja caught a cold, but went to school.'
(u / unexpected-co-occurrence-91 :ARG1 (p / prostudilsja-00 'catch a cold' :experiencer (p2 / person :name (n / name :op1 "Vanja")) :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff) :ARG2 (p3 / poshël-00 'go' :actor p2 :goal (s / shkolu 'school') :Aspect Performance :MODSTR FullAff))

roleset.note: comparison to AMR-2019: This is a new roleset. These were handled with contrast-01 or :concession in AMR.
